Package Servidor

Class ClientAuthentication

java.lang.Object
Servidor.ClientAuthentication
public class ClientAuthentication extends Object
The ClientAuthentication class handles user authentication by storing, encrypting, and verifying user credentials. It uses the AES encryption algorithm to secure passwords and stores the data in a plain text file named users.txt.

  • Method Details

    • checkInUsers

      public void checkInUsers(String userName, String password, String rol) throws Exception
      Registers a new user in the system.
      Parameters:
      userName - The username.
      password - The user's password.
      rol - The user's role.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during encryption.

    • encryptAndSavePassword

      public void encryptAndSavePassword(String password, String password1, String usuario)
      Encrypts and saves a password to the file.
      Parameters:
      password - The password to encrypt.
      password1 - An additional parameter not used.
      usuario - An additional parameter not used.

    • authenticateUser

      public String authenticateUser(String username, String password, String rol)
      Authenticates a user in the system by verifying their username and password.
      Parameters:
      username - The username provided by the user.
      password - The password provided by the user.
      role - The role of the user trying to log in.
      Returns:
      A message indicating whether the authentication was successful or not, along with the user's role if successful, or "false-false" on failure.
